definition: Kansai region, Japan/Guanxi or Kuanhsi town in Hsinchu County 新竹縣|新竹县[Xin1 zhu2 Xian4], northwest Taiwan
mountain pass/to close/to shut/to turn off/to concern/to involve
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
Guanxi or Kuanhsi town in Hsinchu County 新竹縣|新竹县[Xin1 zhu2 Xian4], northwest Taiwan

sentences.english: After killing the local tyrant Zhen Guanxi， for fear of being jailed， Lu Zhishen fled to Mount Wutai where he stayed in a temple as a monk.
sentences.chinese: 魯智深打死惡霸鎮關西后，怕喫官司，逃往他低。

sentences.english: A street war breaks loose between two rival gangs in the Kansai region of Japan.
sentences.chinese: 日本關西地區的兩個對手團伙之間的街頭戰爭打破了。

sentences.english: Q. Why do you continue to stay in the Kansai region?
sentences.chinese: 爲什麼你繼續留在關西地區。

sentences.english: Osaka’s Kansai International airport is just over an hour by train from Kyoto.
sentences.chinese: 大阪關西國際機場離京都剛剛一個小時的火車車程。

sentences.english: There are a number of ways to get to Osaka University from different points in the Kansai Region.
sentences.chinese: 有很多方法可以得到在關西地區的不同點，大阪大學。

sentences.english: Wang hailed the commitment of Kansai to promoting Sino-Japanese friendship and exchanges.
sentences.chinese: 王岐山對關西地區長期致力於中日友好往來表示讚賞。

definition: east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord
Kōbe, major Japanese port near Ōsaka
Northeast China/Manchuria/lit. east of Shanhai Pass 山海關|山海关[Shan1 hai3 guan1]/Kantō region of Japan
virtually the same/differing only on small points
simple home-style meal/common occurrence/nothing out of the ordinary
Shikoku (one of the four main islands of Japan)
to dismount from a horse/(fig.) to abandon (a project)
